Result.Title: Querying Heterogeneous Information Sources Using Source Descriptions

Result.Title: Answering queries using views: A survey

Result.Title: Reconciling Schemas of Disparate Data Sources: A Machine-Learning Approach

Result.Title: Database techniques for the World-Wide Web: a survey

Result.Title: A Query Language for XML

Result.Title: Catching the boat with Strudel: experiences with a Web Site management system

Result.Title: An Adaptive Query Execution System for Data Integration

Result.Title: Data Model and Query Evaluation in Global Information Systems

Result.Title: ULDBs: Databases with Uncertainty and Lineage

Result.Title: Reference reconciliation in complex information spaces

Result.Title: Adaptive Query Processing for Internet Applications

Result.Title: Bootstrapping pay-as-you-go data integration systems

This paper introduces uldbs, an extension of relational databases with simple yet expressive constructs for representing and manipulating both lineage and uncertainty. Uncertain data and data lineage are two important areas of data management that have been considered extensively in isolation,

Result.Title: Databases with uncertainty and lineage

Since it represents a large portion of the structured data on the Web, accessing Deep-Web content has been a long-standing challenge for the database commu- nity. This paper describes a system for surfacing Deep-Web content, i.e., pre-computing submissions for
Result.Title: Google's Deep Web crawl

Result.Abstract: The World-Wide Web consists of a huge number of unstruc- tured documents, but it also contains structured data in the form of HTML tables. We extracted 14.1 billion HTML ta- bles from Google's general-purpose web crawl, and used sta- tistical classification techniques to find the estimated 154M that contain high-quality relational data. Result.Title: WebTables: exploring the power of tables on the web

Result.Title: Data integration and genomic medicine

Result.Title: What Can Peer-to-Peer Do for Databases, and Vice Versa?

Result.Title: Efficient Evaluation of Regular Path Expressions on Streaming XML Data

Result.Abstract: Semantic query optimization refers to the process of using integrity constraints (ic 's) in order to optimize the evaluation of queries. The process is well understood in the case of unions of select-project-join queries (i. e., nonrecursive datalog). For arbitrary datalog programs, however, the issue has largely remained an unsolved problem. This paper studies this problem and shows when semantic
Result.Title: Semantic Query Optimization in Datalog Programs

Result.Abstract: We consider the problems of equivalence, satisfiability and query-reachability for datalog programs with negation and dense-order constraints. These problems are important for optimizing datalog programs. We show that both query-reachability and satisfiability are decidable for programs with stratified negation provided that negation is applied only to EDB predicates or that all EDB predicates are unary. In the latter case, we
Result.Title: Equivalence, query-reachability and satisfiability in Datalog extensions
